text: Dreghorn railway station was a railway station serving the village of Dreghorn, North Ayrshire, Scotland. The station was originally part of the Glasgow, Paisley, Kilmarnock and Ayr Railway. The line forms part of National Cycle Route 73, and the site of the station is marked by signs at the junction with Station Brae, Dreghorn. == History == The station opened on 28 May 1848,Wham, page 57 and closed in October 1850.Butt, page 82 The station reopened in May 1868, and closed permanently to passengers on 6 April 1964, although the line between Irvine and Crosshouse was still in use by trains until October 1965.Stansfield, page 26 == Gallery == Image:Percetonjunction.jpg|Near Perceton Junction, outside Dreghorn.
